channel.title: Question: Anonymity improvement through the operation of a self-hosted bridge?
channel.description:
# Introduction My understanding of Tor is that the biggest anonymity risk with Tor is the accumulation of multiple dishonest Tor relays, so that your entire network path is exposed by one attacker or by multiple attackers with aggregated data.
# Question Would it be wise to run your own self-hosted bridge relay to take advantage of always connecting to a trusted relay?
# Follow-Up Question If I'm right about the idea that a self-hosted Tor bridge improves anonymity guarantees, my follow-up question would be this:
Would it be wiser to use your own bridge exclusively for yourself or would it be better to make the bridge public for other people as well? On the one hand, a private bridge would hide the fact that I'm using the Tor network, but on the other hand, I don't have the company of other users to blend in. What would be the best thoughts if my first assumption is correct?
